name: BRAIN_SPINAL_BIOP
description: Stores data for College of American Pathologists (CAP) form 76011-BRAIN/SPINAL CORD: Biopsy/Resection.

columns.name: RESULT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the result record.

columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify Tumors of the Meninges / Meningothelial Cells.

columns.name: MENINGIOMA_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Meningioma (WHO grade I).

columns.name: TMR_CRANL_PARASPN_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Tumors of Cranial and Paraspinal Nerves.
entries: Malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor (MPNST) (WHO grade II-IV) (Note H, Note I)

columns.name: SCHWANNOMA_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Schwannoma (WHO grade I).

columns.name: PERINEUROMA_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Perineuroma.

columns.name: MPNST_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor (MPNST) (WHO grade II-IV).
entries: MPNST with divergent mesenchymal and/or epithelial differentiation (WHO grade II-IV)

columns.name: EMBRYONAL_TUMORS_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Embryonal Tumors.
entries: Medulloblastoma, not otherwise characterized (WHO grade IV)
Central nervous system (CNS) primitive neuroectodermal tumor (PNET) (WHO grade IV)
Atypical teratoid / rhabdoid tumor (WHO grade IV)

columns.name: MEDULBLSTM_NT_OTH_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Medulloblastoma, not otherwise characterized (WHO grade IV).
entries: Medulloblastoma with extensive nodularity (WHO grade IV)

columns.name: CNS_PNET_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Central nervous system (CNS) primitive neuroectodermal tumor (PNET) (WHO grade IV).

columns.name: TMR_OF_PINEAL_REG_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Tumors of the Pineal Region.
entries: Pineal parenchymal tumor of intermediate differentiation (WHO II-III)
Papillary tumor of the pineal region (WHO grade II-III)

columns.name: NERNL_MXD_N_G_TMR_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Neuronal and Mixed Neuronal-Glial Tumors.
entries: Dysplastic gangliocytoma of cerebellum (Lhermitte-Duclos) (WHO grade I)
Desmoplastic infantile astrocytoma / ganglioglioma (WHO grade I)
Rosette-forming glioneuronal tumor of the fourth ventricle (RGNT) (WHO grade I)
Paraganglioma of the spinal cord (WHO grade I)

columns.name: OTHR_NEUREPTH_TMR_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Other Neuroepithelial Tumors.
entries: Chordoid glioma of the third ventricle (WHO grade II)

columns.name: CHOROID_PLEXS_TMR_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Choroid Plexus Tumors.
entries: Atypical choroid plexus papilloma (WHO grade II)

columns.name: EPENDYMAL_TUMORS_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Ependymal Tumors.

columns.name: EPENDYMOMA_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Ependymoma (WHO grade II).

columns.name: OLIGOASTRCYTC_TMR_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Oligoastrcytic Tumors (mixed glioma).

columns.name: ASTROCYTIC_TUMORS_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Astrocytic Tumors.
entries: Subependymal giant cell astrocytoma (WHO grade I)
Pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma with anaplastic features (WHO grade not assigned)
Gliomatosis cerebri (usually WHO grade III; diagnosis req. clinical-pathological)
Astrocytoma, not otherwise characterized (WHO grades I-IV)

columns.name: DIFFUSE_ASTROCYTM_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Diffuse Astrocytoma (WHO grade II).

columns.name: GLIOBLASTOMA_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Glioblastoma (WHO grade IV).

columns.name: HISTOLOGIC_GRADE_C_NAME
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Histologic Grade.
entries: Favorable (purely epithelial, fetal subtype, mitotically inactive with <=2 mitoses in
Less favorable (all subtypes other than those designated "Favorable" or "Unfavorable"
Unfavorable (small cell undifferentiated or rhabdoid as the predominant or sole histo

columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify histologic grade.
